ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would certainly recommend this class to anyone interested in Medieval Studies. If you want to cover a broad range of interesting topics, read a mix of great books and relevant primary sources, and come away with a much better understanding of the period, then take this class.

the class provided an introduction to several topics related to medieval history, such as source criticism, different kinds of sources as well as different types of secondary scholarship.I would recommend Hist 550
An overview of social history topics and problems. Essential first step to a medievalist. Gained an understanding of method and subject.
History and historiography of medieval England ca. 1000-1250.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Exposure to topics, review of basic "problems" (like feudalism) and laid a foundation for orals exam topics.
